titles: Foolish talking and jesting described and condemned In a discourse on Ephes. 5.4. neither foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient. By Daniel Burgess.
author: Burgess, Daniel, 1645-1713.
publisher: printed for Andrew Bell and Jonas Lumley, at the Pestle and Mortar, over against the Horse-shoe-Tavern in Chancery-Lane,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.).
keywords: Bible. --  N.T. --  Ephesians V, 4 --  Commentaries --  Early works to 1800.
